description: Use the SearchDataSets operation to search for datasets that belong to an account.

parameters.name: AwsAccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters to apply to the search. (dict) --- A filter that you apply when searching for datasets. The comparison operator that you want to use as a filter, for example "Operator": "StringEquals". Valid values are "StringEquals" and "StringLike". If you set the operator value to "StringEquals", you need to provide an ownership related filter in the "NAME" field and the arn of the user or group whose datasets you want to search in the "Value" field. For example, "Name":"QUICKSIGHT_OWNER", "Operator": "StringEquals", "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east- 1:1:user/default/UserName1". If you set the value to "StringLike", you need to provide the name of the datasets you are searching for. For example, "Name":"DATASET_NAME", "Operator": "StringLike", "Value": "Test". The "StringLike" operator only supports the NAME value DATASET_NAME. The name of the value that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Name": "QUICKSIGHT_OWNER". Valid values are defined as follows: QUICKSIGHT_VIEWER_OR_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the dataset owners or viewers are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are considered. QUICKSIGHT_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the owners of the dataset are returned. DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_SOLE_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as the only owner of the dataset are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are not considered. DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the owners if the dataset are returned. DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_VIEWER_OR_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the owners or viewers of the dataset are returned. DATASET_NAME: Any datasets whose names have a substring match to this value will be returned. The value of the named item, in this case QUICKSIGHT_OWNER, that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:user/default/UserName1".

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The comparison operator that you want to use as a filter, for example "Operator": "StringEquals". Valid values are "StringEquals" and "StringLike". If you set the operator value to "StringEquals", you need to provide an ownership related filter in the "NAME" field and the arn of the user or group whose datasets you want to search in the "Value" field. For example, "Name":"QUICKSIGHT_OWNER", "Operator": "StringEquals", "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east- 1:1:user/default/UserName1". If you set the value to "StringLike", you need to provide the name of the datasets you are searching for. For example, "Name":"DATASET_NAME", "Operator": "StringLike", "Value": "Test". The "StringLike" operator only supports the NAME value DATASET_NAME.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the value that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Name": "QUICKSIGHT_OWNER". Valid values are defined as follows:

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the named item, in this case QUICKSIGHT_OWNER, that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:user/default/UserName1".

nested_items.name: DataSetSummaries
nested_items.description: A DataSetSummaries object that returns a summary of a dataset.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A display name for the dataset.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The time that this dataset was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The last time that this dataset was updated.

nested_items.name: ImportMode
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether you want to import the data into SPICE.

nested_items.name: RowLevelPermissionDataSet
nested_items.description: The row-level security configuration for the dataset.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace associated with the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

nested_items.name: PermissionPolicy
nested_items.description: The type of permissions to use when interpreting the permissions for RLS. DENY_ACCESS is included for backward compatibility only.

nested_items.name: FormatVersion
nested_items.description: The user or group rules associated with the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the row-level security permission dataset. If enabled, the status is ENABLED. If disabled, the status is DISABLED.

nested_items.name: RowLevelPermissionTagConfigurationApplied
nested_items.description: Whether or not the row level permission tags are applied.

nested_items.name: ColumnLevelPermissionRulesApplied
nested_items.description: A value that indicates if the dataset has column level permission configured.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The HTTP status of the request.

nested_items.name: RequestId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.
